issue.title: [CF 1625] [8.1] Certain meta icons create 'deadzones' for clicks
issue.body:
ga6663e4d

 

Similar to an issue I reported in WOD alpha, if you remember it. The area at and around some meta icons creates a deadzone for clicks.

 

Disabling the groups, reloading, then reenabling them seems to make it work fine again though? Maybe temporary?


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy | Imported from CurseForge issue #1625 | Raw

comments.body:
I've actually been hearing this a lot from people who don't even use TMW - possible this has nothing to do with TMW at all.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

Use /framestack to see what frames are under your cursor. See if there's any commonalities in all of these deadzones.

 

I'm 99.99% sure it isn't TMW doing this, and if it is, then its a really really weird bug in Blizzard's UI code.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Looks like its something called 'GroupLootContainer'? Whatever that is.

 

E: It's the loot roll frame, for when you can coin something, apparently. 

Edited Dec 11, 2018

> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy
